Articles.Content:
After looking at some pictures of large asteroids and comets that space probes have visited, I realized how cool it would be to land on the more irregular ones. Basically, I think it would be a good idea to have some very large, named, non-procedural, on rails asteroids with very irregular potato-ish shapes. They could be a few km in diameter ( or however you measure something that irregular ) and be placed somewhere near Dres's orbit. They would definitely spice up that region of space.

![q9wo0Lqm.png](%5Bimg%5Dhttp%3A//i.imgur.com/q9wo0Lqm.png)

I mean, look how amazing this would be to land on.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-17T21:51:45Z" title="07/17/2015 09:51  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 17, 2015</time> by Layereddiagram**
Yes please. Also add hooks so we don't bounce like Rosetta.
Agreed, but it seems that any fun suggestion such as this will be instantly written off as "out of scope" by Squad.

> 
> Yes please. Also add hooks so we don't bounce like Rosetta.

I'm nitpicking, but it was Philae that bounced. Unless I'm unaware of a very interesting event.

> 
> I'm nitpicking, but it was Philae that bounced. Unless I'm unaware of a very interesting event.

You're right, I forgot what was what.

Yes Squad wont impliment this however many people ask for it. Unless they do it just to spite me and regex. 

This however would be a nice feature especially with very small gravitational fields.

Outerplanet mod has a moon which is a few km accross and has an irregular shape IIRC

Oops, I just realized that asteroids were on the "what not to suggest list" under the same bullet as new planets, stars e.t.c.

shh! Don't tell anyone.

Is there a mod that does this?

I don't know of any.

Because there seem to be no mods for this I think there may be some technical issue.

Maybe they would use too much RAM?

I don't know of any either. 

I would assume that the limiting factor would be creating something that irregular and (relatively) small without causing glitches and bugs. Plus something that size would have practically non-existent gravity or none at all and due to its non spherical shape, they wouldn't be able to just have gravity radiating from a point at the center.

Those are just guesses though. I have the same level of knowledge about coding as a fuel tank.![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
you should ask the creator off outer planets mod to make some, they already have one.

As an alternative, perhaps the NK Asteroids that we can track, find, capture, or redirect be reshaped to more potatoes and such. The trade-off being more difficulty in towing or pushing them as the center of gravity for them would be crazy hard to adjust for.

> 
> Yes please. Also add hooks so we don't bounce like Rosetta.

Alternate idea: Make claws of probe size and also make it so that claws can grab onto planetary surfaces like they were meant to in the first place.

> 
> Gilly

I was thinking less Vesta shaped and more Eros shaped.
